text: so another thing that I talked to
customers a lot about is organizational
change management and to a lot of
companies when they hear that term or
they hear the term ocm they tend to
think of communication plans and that's
the first thing that folks go to is okay
great we have we've put together a
communication plan we've sent out a
message to the organization to let them
know that we've got a cloud mandate in
place we're moving to the cloud we're
all in this is what we're doing and then
oftentimes that's kind of the end of it
and the expectation is that you know
directors and managers and other folks
within the organization will take the
ball run with it continue to communicate
to their teams and it will just kind of
take off from there and the thing about
organizational change is that is often
missed is that really change is
internalized on a very individual basis
not on an organizational level and at
that organizational level it's really
truly just the compilation of all of
those individual decisions that are made
around whether or not they're ready to
accept that change that's being
presented to them and so I really think
that looking at it through that lens
it's very is very different thinking
about it in terms of each individual
within the organization when they hear
this decision that's happening this new
initiative that's taking place in the
organization they're immediately
thinking not how does this impact the
organization how cool is this technology
how fantastic is this going to be for my
team I can't wait to get started that's
unlikely to be their first reaction and
their first reaction is to think what
does that mean to me how does that
affect my job what I what do I tell my
wife or my husband when I go home about
how my role is changing do I know how my
role is changing do I still have a role
there asking those types of questions
and so when you think about change
management on that individual level it
really has a powerful impact on how you
communicate what's going on to the
organization it's important to recognize
that you need to have many different
vehicles for communicating
many different modalities the messaging
needs to be focused and intentional and
it really needs to be able to hit that
individual and to understand sort of
where's the place where are they at in
terms of acceptance of what's going on
awareness we talked about the changed
curve and so understanding sort of where
individuals are in the organization at
any given point in time bringing
managers direct supervisors into the
discussion so that they understand how
to have those conversations with their
employees is incredibly important it's
not just about blanket communication to
the company because every team every
individual on those teams is going to
hear and interpret that information very
differently
[Music]
